creator: shuiguolan_pg@163.com
text:
Created attachment 30685
jtl

I have read the usermanual document of jmeter: 

the value of throughout in my aggregate report seems not match the result of formula of throughout which can be found on  usermanual document (http://jmeter.apache.org/usermanual/glossary.html#Throughput)

some data from my aggregate:
samples: 593
the duration of testing is 60 sec
and the throughout is 6.51/sec

issue:
if use the formula of throughout, the throughout should be 9.88(593/60), and the aggregate report shows 6.51. why?

I have uploaded the jtl log, and please give me feedback, thanks.

Hi,

I don`t agree that your test lasted 60 seconds.

I`ve loaded your jtl file to View Result Tree listener and extracted following informations:

First Sample in View Results Tree
Sample Start: 2013-08-07 09:29:37

Last Sample in View Results Tree
Sample Start: 2013-08-07 09:30:18
Load time: 50067

We can now calculate test run duration in seconds:
It is 41 seconds between first and last sample in test, but we have to add Load time of a last sample which is 50 seconds. So whole test duration is 41+50 = 91 seconds.

Now let`s calculate throughput:
593/91 is about 6,51

For me, throughput is calculated correctly.
creator: franojr@o2.pl
